London 20s and 30s Pub Social - Central London
description:
**It's back. By popular demand - we're excited to be hosting another one of our HUGE Friday night pub social for London 20s and 30s at the Oyster Shed, overlooking the Thames in Central London.**

Yep, no games, no organised fun or activities - just another chance for you to chat and connect with lots of other 20s and 30s and have a few drinks.

We've once again booked out a huge area at the the Oyster Shed so you can let off some steam after a long working week, and get to know some of our community better.

After the social, there's often a series of "after party" adventures you can join, depending on whether you'd fancy food, another drink or a night on the town.

Whether you are new to our 20s and 30s events or a seasoned veteran, you are very welcome to join us for what is always a very memorable night.

As we are now very close to full capacity, rather than running a waiting list - we will be charging a small £5 fee.

The money of which will go to equipment for new events we’re planning (e.g. further picnics, sports days) and perhaps even a big summer party.

However, even these last spots are limited and so please do RSVP as soon as possible to avoid missing out 👍

\- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \-

**WHERE/WHEN WE WILL MEET**

Venue - The Oyster Shed, 1 Angel Ln, London EC4R 3AB

Closest Tube stations: Monument (2 Min Walk), Cannon Street (3 Min Walk), London Bridge (10 Min Walk)

Location: [https://g.page/TheOysterShed?share](https://g.page/TheOysterShed?share)

Meet Time - 7:00pm

Finish time: 11:00pm

\- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \-

**HEALTH AND SAFETY**

I'm sure you guys all know the drill by now, but just a reminder that everyone is responsible for their own safety at the pub and so do take the usual precautions before attending.

name: FREE Board Games Night - London 20s and 30s
description:
**On Wednesday 20th July, we're excited to be hosting our next FREE Board Games Night for London 20s and 30s.**

We’ll be heading to the Blighty café in North London to enjoy a large selection of board games and have a pint or a cocktail or two!

We will be providing a selection of board games for you to play during the board games night, but you’re more than welcome to bring your own too!

We have booked out a big space at the café and so you will hopefully get to play many games throughout the evening and meet many wonderful Londoners in their 20s and 30s.

So if you're looking to play some games, meet new people, and have a laugh then we'd love to have you.

**\- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \-**

**THE GAMES**

To keep the games as inclusive and accessible as possible for everyone, we tend to encourage groups to play one of a considerable number of easy-to-play party or social board games that we will be offering.

On top of this, to ensure you get plenty of chances to meet other 20s and 30s over the course of the evening, we like to rotate the groups and so we tend not to encourage longer games.

To ensure that everyone has a great time, please let the organiser know if you are bringing your own games before the event or when you arrive at the event.

**\- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \-**

**WHERE/WHEN**

We've booked out a large space in the Blighty cafe in Tottenham.

Address: Blighty Cafe - Tottenham, 266 High Road, London, N15 4AJ

Location: [https://g.page/BlightyTottenham?share](https://g.page/BlightyTottenham?share)

Nearest Tube Station: Seven Sisters Underground (approx 3 min walk)

Start Time: 7:00 PM

End Time: 11:00 PM

Please arrive before 8pm. If you arrive after 8pm then you may be refused entry to the event.

name: FREE Social Walk, Games & Pub - Greenwich Park
description:
**It’s here. It’s landed. Another Sunday and we’ve got you covered once again with yet another new Social Walk and Pub trip for London 20s and 30s.**

For our latest 20s and 30s walk, we’ll be visiting one of the most stunning parks and walking spots in London, Greenwich Park.

We will be starting out the walk in the green bushy pastures of Blackheath. From there, we will wander into Greenwich Park where we’ll take in some of the most famous views overlooking London and the Old Royal Observatory.

After taking in the sights, we will then venture along the River Thames past the historic sailing ship, the Cutty Sark and the O2, to North Greenwich.

We will then finish up at the Pilot in Greenwich where you can grab a drink, play some games and get to know your fellow hikers a bit better.

There's also plenty of green space around the pub, in case you'd prefer to have a picnic and play some park games instead.

**As with all our social walks, the afternoon will feature:**

* A Range of Fun, Games and Entertainment
* Speed Friending Activities
* Expert Games Host and Walk Guide
* Plenty of Like-Minded 20s to 30s
* The Great Outdoors and Stunning Scenery
* A Trip to the Pub (Optional but highly recommended!)

Unfortunately owing to the size of the venue, we will be having to cap numbers for this event.

And so do make sure you nab your place as soon as you can - as we will be having to turn off RSVPS when we’re nearing the capacity limit.

**HOW IT WORKS**

We will be meeting on the grass opposite the Köy Grill on the edge of Blackheath at 2pm.

To start the event, you will be allocated a group/team for an initial mix of fun ice breaker games designed to get people talking and help you to get to know some of the other participants on the walk a little better.

After the games, we will commence our walk through Greenwich Park. Along the way, there will be a number of pit-stops, where we will rotate the groups and play more social games.

After a few hours of nature, getting to know each other and working up a thirst, we'll head to a local pub and have a couple of drinks.

**WHERE/WHEN WE WILL MEET**

Meet Point - Opposite Köy Grill, 10 Royal Parade, Blackheath, London SE3 0TL (Location: [https://g.page/KoyGrillBlackheath?share](https://g.page/KoyGrillBlackheath?share))

Closest stations: Blackheath (5 mins walk)

Destination: The Pilot, Greenwich

Meet Time - 2:00pm (We will be leaving at 2:10pm, so don't be late!)

Finish time: 5:00pm

Pub Finish time: 7:00pm-8:30pm (Approx)

**WHAT TO BRING**

* Hiking shoes, boots or other suitable footwear
* Good Waterproof jacket and trousers (in case it rains!)
* Warm/Windproof layer (as it's London)
* Camera & phone
* Snacks
* Face mask, Hand Sanitizer etc.

**HEALTH AND SAFETY**

I'm sure you guys all know the drill by now, but just a reminder that everyone is responsible for their own safety on the walk and at the pub!
Finally, the pub element is optional and so if you’d prefer not to head off following the walk, then no worries at all!

name: FULL- Community Day Trip to Southend - Social Walk, Shuffleboard & Crazy Golf
description:
**On Saturday 16th July, we are very excited to be hosting our latest 20s and 30s Community Away Day, this time to Southend-on-Sea!**

For this special trip, we’ve lined up a whole day of fun activities to enjoy, as well as providing plenty of opportunities to connect with your fellow 20s and 30s.

**The day will consist of:**

* **A social walk along the Essex coastline**
* **Chance to relaxing at the beach**
* **Exploration of Southend’s famous pier, which is the world’s longest pleasure pier**
* **Fun and games at a traditional seafront arcade**
* **Crazy Golf and Shuffleboard at Caddies**

We would love to open this up-to everyone who wishes to join but sadly at present, we are limiting numbers to just 20 places for this event and these will be offered on a first come, first serve basis.

So if you are keen to join, please do RSVP as soon as you can!

**GETTING THERE**

The group will be meeting at 9:45 in Fenchurch Street Station to get the train together to Southend Central.
The journey is approximately 1 hour long, so we will be bringing along some little games to pass the time and get to know each other a bit better.

Everyone will need to book their own train tickets. Advance train tickets start from £13.50 are some great early bird deals available. On top of this, if you own a railcard, you'll be able to save 1/3 off that fare.

Once we have our confirmed group, you will be able to join a WhatsApp group so that we can get the same train together.

**WHERE/WHEN**

We will be meeting outside Fenchurch Street Station at 9.45.

**Meet Point:** Leon Fenchurch Street - [https://goo.gl/maps/WYeogvz5WtoxgPLb9](https://goo.gl/maps/WYeogvz5WtoxgPLb9)

**Meet Time:** 9:45am (Please arrive promptly or early, otherwise you will be in danger of missing us and maybe the train)

**Train Time:** 10:00am

**Return:** After this jammed packed day of fun, we’ll then be heading back to London at around 21:30pm, depending on the decision of the group

**ATTENDANCE FEE**

We don’t typically like to charge for events, but in this case, we will be charging £11.95 which will secure your place for the trip and cover the cost of your crazy golf, Shuffleboard and a drink at Caddies.

There will also be opportunities throughout the day for you to buy whatever food you would like to eat, including at Caddies in the evening.

name: FULL - Drink and Do - Pottery, Arts and Crafts Social
description:
**After being a huge hit, we're pleased to announce that on Friday 15th July, we'll be once again hosting our popular Drink and Do Social for London 20s and 30s.**

For this, we'll be returning to the newly opened ArtPlay in Liverpool Street for an evening of arts, crafts and social drinks.

We’ve booked out the entire venue just for you guys and they’ve kindly agreed to line up a whole host of activities, so that you’ll have opportunity to try a range of crafts such as pottery, painting and decoupage.

The theme of the evening will be "Space and the Beyond" and as part of this, and the venue will be providing all the artistic tools and materials you’ll need to paint your own galaxy canvas or design everything from your own mud rock planets, papier-mâchée spaceships to clay aliens.

And you will get to take home whatever you design or create on the night for no additional fee.

There will also prosecco, wine and beer available to buy on the night, so you can drink while you paint, craft and design.

As with all our events, the evening of arts and crafts will of course provide plenty of chance for you to chat and connect with other 20s and 30s.

The evening will run from 7:30pm till 10pm but for those who want to, there will also be option to go out for more Friday Night drinks at a nearby pub.

Unfortunately owing to the size of the venue, we can only accommodate a small number of people for this particular event.

And so do make sure you nab your place as soon as you can - as we will be having to turn off RSVPS when we’ve reached the capacity limit.

**WHERE/WHEN WE WILL MEET**

Venue - Art Play, 56 Middlesex St, London E1 7EZ (see location: [https://goo.gl/maps/m8NdqsZHnve4Qj3E8](https://goo.gl/maps/m8NdqsZHnve4Qj3E8))

Closest stations: Liverpool Street (5 min walk)

Start Time - 7:30pm

Finish time: 10:00pm

**ATTENDANCE FEE**

Attendance for the night is £15 and this includes all of the materials you’ll need to create your designs.

Unfortunately these places are very limited and will be offered on a first come, first serve basis. So if you are keen to join, please do RSVP as soon as you can!

name: Picnic, Park & Pints - London 20s and 30s Social
description:
**There's lots of lovely hot weather to look forward to this week and so we thought what better way to celebrate than to have our latest afterwork "Picnic, Park & Pints".**

Yep, we’ll be making the most of the sun and late nights, getting the drinks flowing, the tunes and enjoying some fun in the sun.

The picnic will take place in Hyde Park from 6pm, and over the course of the evening, as well as enjoying some drinks and plenty of snacks.

On top of this, for those who want wish to do so, there will be an option to get involved with games like football, frisbee and other outdoor fun.

Of course, like with all our events - you’ll have plenty of chance to chat, chill and get to know other 20s and 30s.

We aren’t limited by space for this event, but we will be capping numbers so as to keep the group size manageable and intimate.

And so do make sure you nab your place as soon as you can - as we will be having to turn off RSVPS when we’re nearing the capacity limit.

\- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \-

**WHERE/WHEN WE WILL MEET**

**Meet Point -** Kensington Gardens Bandstand (Exact location - [https://goo.gl/maps/hS9T58cpHr1EFAtp8](https://goo.gl/maps/hS9T58cpHr1EFAtp8))

**Closest stations -** Queensway (10 min walk), High Street Kensington (10 min walk)

**Start Time -** From 6:00pm

**Finish time:** 10:00pm (approx, although you’re welcome to leave or stay when you wish)

name: Social Walk, Games and Pub Quiz - Royal Parks (Central London)
description:
**It's back and this one will be bigger than ever! On Sunday 10th July, we're really excited to once again be hosting a Social Walk and Pub Quiz for 20s and 30s in the very heart of Central London.**

For this special social hike, we will be once again be walking through all three Royal Parks, starting at Hyde Park through Green Park and finally, St James Park.

Along the way, we'll be flying past some of the most famous landmarks and sights of London, like Big Ben and the Houses of Parliament. We will then cross Westminster Bridge and end up in Waterloo.

This walk will be made extra special as following the walk, we'll be hosting our monthly creative and quirky pub quiz for you to enjoy.

As always, on the walk we will be playing a series of fun and entertaining ice breaker games designed to help you meet and hopefully have a bit of a laugh with your fellow hikers.

The event will feature:

* A Range of Fun, Games and Entertainment
* Speed Friending Activities
* Expert Games Host and Walk Guide
* Plenty of Like-Minded 20s to 30s
* The Great Outdoors and Stunning Scenery
* A Trip to the Pub
* Social Pub Quiz with prizes

As we are now very close to full capacity, rather than running a waiting list - we will be charging a small £5 fee.
 The money of which will go to equipment for new events we’re planning (e.g. further picnics, sports days) and perhaps even a big summer party. However, even these last spots are limited and so please do RSVP as soon as possible to avoid missing out 👍

**HOW IT WORKS**

The walk will start from Hyde Park by the Kensington Gardens Bandstand.

To start the event, you will be allocated a group/team for an initial mix of fun ice breaker games designed to get people talking and help you to get to know some of the other participants on the walk a little better.

Throughout the walk from Hyde Park to Waterloo, there will be a number of pit-stops to give you a chance to speak to ensure you get a chance to speak to plenty of other 20s and 30s along the way.

We've booked out a large number of tables at the pub, so that you can get your quiz on, put your feet up, grab food and have a drink or two with your fellow hikers.

**WHERE/WHEN WE WILL MEET**

Meet Point - Kensington Gardens Bandstand ([https://goo.gl/maps/hS9T58cpHr1EFAtp8](https://goo.gl/maps/hS9T58cpHr1EFAtp8))

Closest tube stations: High Street Kensington (10 Min walk), Gloucester Road (15 min walk), South Kensington (15 min walk)

Destination: Thirsty Bear, Waterloo

Meet Time - 14:00pm (we will leave promptly, so don't be late!)

Walk Finish time: 17:00 (approx)

Pub Finish time: 18:30pm (approx)

**WHAT TO BRING**

* Hiking shoes, boots or other suitable footwear
* Good Waterproof jacket and trousers (in case it rains!)
* Warm/Windproof layer (as it's London)
* Camera & phone
* Snacks
* Face mask, Hand Sanitizer etc.

**HEALTH AND SAFETY**

I'm sure you guys all know the drill by now, but just a reminder that everyone is responsible for their own safety on the walk and at the pub!

The picnic will take place in Hyde Park from 1pm, and over the course of the afternoon, as well as enjoying some drinks and plenty of snacks - there will be an option of playing a selection of park and outdoor games, such as boules, badminton, frisbee and possibly rounders.

Of course, like with all our events - you’ll have plenty of chance to chat, chill and get to know other 20s and 30s.

We aren’t limited by space for this event, but we will be capping numbers so as to keep the group size manageable and intimate.

name: FULL - The Brunch Club Social
description:
**On Saturday 9th July, we are excited to host our latest Brunch Club Social for London 20s and 30s.**

For anyone new to our events, our brunch club is one of the most popular of our smaller groups.

Every month, the group visits some of the best brunch and coffee spots London has to offer.

The socials are designed to give you a chance to enjoy some great food, stimulating conversation and of course, connect with plenty of 20s and 30s in a chilled and relaxed setting.

For this month's social, we will be visiting the The Table Cafe near London Bridge and Southwark.

This independent cafe was voted best brunch in London by Time Out readers and uses only London produce.

Their all day menu includes an amazing full english (and veggie alternative), as well as pancakes, waffles and other classic brunch dishes.

After the event, the group often then embark on a post-brunch activity, trip to the park or walk and so the day is well worth joining for, if you want to do something special with your Saturday.

To create a more intimate group vibe and foster better conversations, we limit our brunch events to around 12-16 people and these places are offered on a first come, first serve basis.

Since we make reservations for these tables, we ask for a small £5 deposit for your attendance, which will be taken off the bill.

We do this to ensure we can provide the restaurant with an accurate sense of numbers, and help ensure you can have a full table of fellow 20s and 30s.

And so do make sure you nab your place as soon as you can - as we will be having to turn off RSVPS when we've reached the capacity limit.

**WHERE/WHEN WE WILL MEET**

Venue - The Table Cafe, 83 Southwark Street, London, SE1 0HX

Closest Tube stations: Southwark (5 mins walk), London Bridge (10 mins walk), Waterloo (15 mins walk)

Location: [https://g.page/thetablecafe?share](https://g.page/thetablecafe?share)

Meet Time - 10:30am

Finish time: 12:30pm

**HEALTH AND SAFETY**

I'm sure you guys all know the drill by now, but just a reminder that everyone is responsible for their own safety at the pub and so do take the usual precautions before attending.

name: FREE Social Walk, Games and Pub - Primrose Hill
description:
**Another Sunday, and for this latest social walk for London 20s and 30s, we're excited to be heading back to one of the most stunning walk spots in London and visiting Primrose Hill on Sunday 3rd July.**

For this latest free walk, we'll be hiking from Westbourne Park, along the Little Venice canals, all the way to Primrose Hill, to enjoy its famous viewpoint overlooking London.

As always, after the walk, we will then head to one of our favourite pubs next door to the hill for a few drinks and to give you a chance to rest your legs.

As with all our social walks, the event will feature:

* A Range of Fun, Games and Entertainment
* Speed Friending Activities
* Expert Games Host and Walk Guide
* Plenty of Like-Minded 20s to 30s
* The Great Outdoors and Stunning Scenery
* A Trip to the Pub (and a Sunday Roast for those who want it)!

**HOW IT WORKS**

The walk will start from Emslie Horniman's Pleasance Park at 2:30pm.

To start the event, you will be allocated a group/team for an initial mix of fun ice breaker games designed to get people talking and help you to get to know your fellow 20s and 30s a little better.

After the games, we will commence our 2-3 hour walk from Westbourne Park to Primrose Hill. Along the way, there will be a number of pit-stops (approx every 30-40 mins).

After a few hours of nature, getting to know each other and working up a thirst, we'll head to a local pub, have a couple of drinks and get food (if you want it).

**WHERE/WHEN WE WILL MEET**

Meet Point - Emslie Horniman's Pleasance Park, Kensal Rd, London W10 5EG (Exact Location: [https://goo.gl/maps/QFtEYFWy53RroN366](https://goo.gl/maps/QFtEYFWy53RroN366))

name: Zombie Apocalypse Laser Tag | London 20-30s Social
description:
**The zombie invasion has reached London. The streets lie deserted, and it’s just you and your fellow London 20s and 30s, that stand in the way of the total wipeout of human race.**

Yep we don’t do boring Wednesdays and so on 29th June, instead of doing laundry, we’ll be heading to a Cold War-style nuclear bunker for an adrenaline-fuelled evening of zombie slaying.

We’ve booked out London's number one military laser tag arena just for you guys, so you can go up against live zombies and your fellow 20s and 30s in a series of epic and fast-paced shootout games.

Over the course of the evening, you’ll have to fend off, avoid, shoot, and contain a hoard of gory lurking zombies in a number of mission-focused games that’ll test your shooting and strategy.

The venue has been kitted out with mazes, props and live zombies to provide a truly immersive zombie apocalypse experience.

Meanwhile you’ll be provided with of the most technologically advanced laser tag equipment around to battle the infected and eliminate the zombie army (and keep track of your scores).

Unfortunately as the venue can only fit a limited amount of zombie hunters, places will be offered on a first come, first serve basis. So if you are keen to join, please do RSVP as soon as you can.

\- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \-

**HOW IT WORKS**

The social will begin from 6:30pm at a local pub near the venue, where you’ll be able to get some much-needed dutch courage and get to know your fellow zombie hunters a little better before the big entertainment of the evening.

As a group, we will then head over to Bunker 51 for a safety briefing and to get kitted up at 7:30pm.

When you’ve chosen your weapons, we will be strapping on our guns and going face-to-face with a horde of live zombies in a series of games and battles, such as:

**Team Death Match** – Compete against your fellow 20s and 30s in an epic team death match game.

**Zombie Attack –** Score points for your group by shooting the zombie hoard and avoid being caught by the zombies.

**Scare Maze –** Navigate your way through our terrifying scare maze, filled with gory and lurking zombies.

**Zombie Containment –** The final mission is to locate all escaped zombies and herd them back into containment.

At the end of the session, you will receive a de-briefing and a score card with your results, so you can find out who in the group stands the best chance of survival in a zombie apocalypse.

At the end of all this, if you have survived the zombie hoards and want to make the most of your Wednesday, we will be heading local pub to grab a drink, chat and debrief about the experience.

\- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \-

**WHERE/WHEN**

Pub Address: Anchor & Hope, Riverside, London SE7 7SS ([https://goo.gl/maps/SruVTj2JJUFacJp28](https://goo.gl/maps/SruVTj2JJUFacJp28)**)**

Venue Address: Bunker 51, 3 Herringham Rd, London SE7 8NJ

Nearest Tube Stations: Charlton (15 mins walk), Westcombe Park (20 min walk), North Greenwich (15 min by bus)

Pub Start Time: 6:30 PM

Zombie Start Time: 7:30 PM (can meet at venue)

End Time: 10:00 PM (Approx)

name: Free Social Walk, Games & Pub - Wandsworth Common
description:
**It’s landed. Another Sunday. And we're excited to be hosting yet another special Summer Social Walk and Pub trip for London 20s and 30s.**

For this latest free social walk, we’ll be heading back to South West London for one of our favourite hikes from Wandsworth Common to Battersea.

As part of this, we’ll be wandering through the green pastures of Wandsworth Common, then down the river thames to Battersea Park.

Finally, after a wander through the park and past the famous London Peace Pagoda, we will be ending up at an amazing (covered) pub garden in Battersea for a drink, food and games.

As with all our social walks, the event will feature:

* A Range of Fun, Games and Entertainment
* Speed Friending Activities
* Expert Games Host and Walk Guide
* Plenty of Like-Minded 20s to 30s
* The Great Outdoors and Stunning Scenery
* A Trip to the Pub (Optional but highly recommended!)

**HOW IT WORKS**

The walk will start at Wandsworth Common (we will be meeting on the grass opposite a pub called The Hope).

To start the event, you will be allocated a group/team for an initial mix of fun ice breaker games designed to get people talking and help you to get to know some of the other participants on the walk a little better.

After the games, we will commence our 2-3 hour walk from the Wandsworth Common to Battersea. Along the way, there will be a number of pit-stops (approx every 30-40 mins) where we will rotate the groups and play more social games.

After a few hours of nature, getting to know each other and working up a thirst, we'll head to a local pub and have a couple of drinks (and food, if you want it).

**WHERE/WHEN WE WILL MEET**

Meet Point - Wandsworth Common (Exact Location: [https://goo.gl/maps/x7JBtsxkubFrG5PB8](https://goo.gl/maps/x7JBtsxkubFrG5PB8))

Closest station: Wandsworth Common (5 min walk) and Balham (15 min walk)

Destination: Magic Garden, Battersea

Meet Time - 14:00pm (we will leave at 14:10, so don't be late!)

Walk Finish time: 17:00pm (approx)

Pub Finish time: 7:00pm-8:30pm (Approx)

**WHAT TO BRING**

* Hiking shoes, boots or other suitable footwear
* Good Waterproof jacket and trousers (in case it rains!)
* Warm/Windproof layer (as it's London)
* Camera & phone
* Snacks
* Face mask, Hand Sanitizer etc.

**HEALTH AND SAFETY**

I'm sure you guys all know the drill by now, but just a reminder that everyone is responsible for their own safety on the walk and at the pub!

Finally, the pub element is optional and so if you’d prefer not to head off following the walk, then no worries at all!

description:
**On Wednesday 22nd June, we're delighted to be hosting our next FREE Board Games Night for London 20s and 30s.**

We’ll be heading to the Blighty café in North London to enjoy a large selection of board games and have a pint or a cocktail or two!

We will be providing a selection of board games for you to play during the board games night, but you’re more than welcome to bring your own too!

description:

For this latest social walk, we’ll be hiking across some of East London's most beautiful parks from Stratford to Angel.

We will be starting out the Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, where you'll be able to see the London Stadium and some of the famous sporting arenas from the 2012 Olympics.

We will then cross the Olympic park and into Victoria Park, before wandering down the Regent's Canal to a pub in Angel where you can grab a drink, rest your legs and get to know your fellow hikers a bit better.

name: FULL - Drink and Do - Pottery, Arts and Crafts Social
description:
**After being a huge hit, we're pleased to announce that on Friday 17th June, we'll be once again hosting our popular Drink and Do Social for London 20s and 30s.**

For this, we'll be returning to the newly opened ArtPlay in Liverpool Street for an evening of arts, crafts and social drinks.

We’ve booked out the entire venue just for you guys and they’ve kindly agreed to line up a whole host of activities, so that you’ll have opportunity to try a range of crafts such as pottery, painting, candle jar decorating, and decoupage.

The theme of the evening will be "Beach, Ocean and Sea Life" and as part of this, and the venue will be providing all the artistic tools and materials you’ll need to paint your own ocean view or design everything from your own miniature beach to pottery sea creatures.

And you will get to take home whatever you design or create on the night for no additional fee.

There will also prosecco, wine and beer available to buy on the night, so you can drink while you paint, craft and design.

As with all our events, the evening of arts and crafts will of course provide plenty of chance for you to chat and connect with other 20s and 30s.

The evening will run from 7:30pm till 10pm but for those who want to, there will also be option to go out for more Friday Night drinks at a nearby pub.

Unfortunately owing to the size of the venue, we can only accommodate a small number of people for this particular event.

And so do make sure you nab your place as soon as you can - as we will be having to turn off RSVPS when we’ve reached the capacity limit.

**WHERE/WHEN WE WILL MEET**

Venue - Art Play, 56 Middlesex St, London E1 7EZ (see location: [https://goo.gl/maps/m8NdqsZHnve4Qj3E8](https://goo.gl/maps/m8NdqsZHnve4Qj3E8))

Closest stations: Liverpool Street (5 min walk)

Start Time - 7:30pm

Finish time: 10:00pm

**ATTENDANCE FEE**

Attendance for the night is £15 and this includes all of the materials you’ll need to create your designs.

Unfortunately these places are very limited and will be offered on a first come, first serve basis. So if you are keen to join, please do RSVP as soon as you can!

Yep, we’ll be making the most of the sun and late nights, getting the drinks flowing, the tunes and enjoying some fun in the sun.

The picnic will take place in Hyde Park from 6pm, and over the course of the evening, as well as enjoying some drinks and plenty of snacks.

On top of this, for those who want wish to do so, there will be an option to get involved with games like football, frisbee and other outdoor fun.

Of course, like with all our events - you’ll have plenty of chance to chat, chill and get to know other 20s and 30s.

We aren’t limited by space for this event, but we will be capping numbers so as to keep the group size manageable and intimate.

name: FULL - Go Karting Grand Prix | London 20s and 30s Social
description:
**The long Jubilee bank holiday may sadly now be behind us, but don’t worry as on Tuesday 14th June, we’ve got a very special evening of adrenaline-fuelled midweek fun lined up for you.**

Yep that’s right, rather than having a boring Tuesday, we’ll be heading to one London’s best outdoor karting tracks to have our very own Grand Prix and battle it out against each other in a series of fast-paced races.

We’ve then booked out the whole track at one of Revolution Karts in Mile End, so you can compete against your fellow 20s and 30s to be crowned the F1 champion of the group.

The venue offers the fastest karts in Central London driving speeds of up-to 45mph. Meanwhile, for just £31.20pp, it’s also easily the best value go-karting experience the capital has to offer.

To top of all that competitive fun, over the course of the night - as with all our events - you'll of course have have plenty of opportunity to meet and connect with other Londoners in their 20s and 30.

\- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \-

**HOW IT WORKS**

The social night will begin at 7:00pm at one of our favourite pubs near Canary Wharf, where you can get to know your fellow racers a little better and have dinner before the big entertainment of the evening.

When we’ve all had chance to grab a bite to eat, we will then head over to Revolution Karts to get revved up for the big races at 9pm.

After a quick safety briefing, we will then go up against each other and compete in a series of fast-paced 8 lap races against one another on their famous outdoor track.

If you are still in the mood to make the most of your Tuesday, after the races have finished, there will also be the option to go to a local pub to debrief about the Grand Prix, chat and grab a drink with your fellow racers.

\- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \-

**The Waiting List**

Attendance for the night is £31.20pp and this covers the cost of all your races, as well as hire of a balaclava and racing gloves.

**Unfortunately the event is now full. If you'd like to join the waiting list, please click here: [https://survey.zohopublic.eu/zs/jBBj7w](https://survey.zohopublic.eu/zs/jBBj7w)**

name: Free Social Walk, Games and Pub Quiz - Royal Parks (Central London)
description:
**You knew it was coming... another month, and on Sunday 12th June, we'll once again be hosting our very popular Social Walk and Monthly Pub Quiz for 20s and 30s.**

For this special social hike, we'll once again be walking through all three Royal Parks, starting at Hyde Park through Green Park and finally, St James Park.

Along the way, we'll be flying past some of the most famous landmarks and sights of London, like Big Ben and the Houses of Parliament. We will then cross Westminster Bridge and end up in Waterloo.

This walk is always one to remember as following the walk, we'll be hosting our creative and quirky pub quiz for you to enjoy.

As always, on the walk we will be playing a series of fun and entertaining ice breaker games designed to help you meet and hopefully have a bit of a laugh with your fellow hikers.

The event will feature:

* A Range of Fun, Games and Entertainment
* Speed Friending Activities
* Expert Games Host and Walk Guide
* Plenty of Like-Minded 20s to 30s
* The Great Outdoors and Stunning Scenery
* A Trip to the Pub
* Social Pub Quiz with prizes

**HOW IT WORKS**

The walk will start from Hyde Park, by the Kensington Gardens Bandstand.

To start the event, you will be allocated a group/team for an initial mix of fun ice breaker games designed to get people talking and help you to get to know some of the other participants on the walk a little better.

Throughout the walk from Hyde Park to Waterloo, there will be a number of pit-stops (approx every 30-40 mins) to enable for everyone to catch up, play some more social games and allow us to rotate the groups, so you don’t end up talking to the same people for the entire walk.

We've booked out a large number of tables at the pub, so that you can get your quiz on, put your feet up, grab food and have a drink or two with your fellow hikers/quizzers.

**WHERE/WHEN WE WILL MEET**

Meet Point - Kensington Gardens Bandstand ([https://goo.gl/maps/hS9T58cpHr1EFAtp8](https://goo.gl/maps/hS9T58cpHr1EFAtp8))

Closest tube stations: High Street Kensington (10 Min walk), Gloucester Road (15 min walk), South Kensington (15 min walk)

Destination: Thirsty Bear, Waterloo

* Hiking shoes, boots or other suitable footwear
* Good Waterproof jacket and trousers (in case it rains!)
* Warm/Windproof layer (as it's London)
* Camera & phone
* Snacks
* Face mask, Hand Sanitizer etc.

name: FULL - The Brunch Club Social
description:
**On Saturday 4th June, we are excited to host our very first, official Brunch Club Social for London 20s and 30s.**

For anyone new to our events, our brunch club is one of the most popular of our smaller groups.

Every month, the group visits some of the best brunch and coffee spots London has to offer.

The socials are designed to give you a chance to enjoy some great food, stimulating conversation and of course, connect with plenty of 20s and 30s in a chilled and relaxed setting.

For this month, we will be visiting the Caravan restaurant in the heart of Central London (Fitzrovia): **[https://www.caravanrestaurants.co.uk](https://www.caravanrestaurants.co.uk)**

The restaurant is housed in the stunning former BBC Radio 1 HQ and serves a delicious brunch menu, as well as house roasted coffee and cocktails.

After the event, the group often then embark on a post-brunch activity or walk and so the day is well worth joining for, if you want to do something special with your bank holiday Saturday.

To create a more intimate group vibe and foster better conversations, we limit our brunch events to around 12-16 people and these places are offered on a first come, first serve basis.

Meanwhile, since we make reservations for these tables, we ask for a small £5 deposit for your attendance, which will go towards the eventual bill, to cover the service charge etc.

We do this to ensure there isn't any shortfall but also so we can provide the restaurant with an accurate sense of numbers, and help ensure you can have a full table of fellow 20s and 30s.

And so do make sure you nab your place as soon as you can - as we will be having to turn off RSVPS when we've reached the capacity limit.

**WHERE/WHEN WE WILL MEET**

Venue - Caravan Fitzrovia, 152 Great Portland St, London W1W 6AJ

Closest Tube stations: Goodge Street (5 mins walk)

Location: [https://goo.gl/maps/wyB3ZVzDPfQMJQvk9](https://goo.gl/maps/wyB3ZVzDPfQMJQvk9)

Meet Time - 10:00am

Finish time: 12:00pm

**HEALTH AND SAFETY**

I'm sure you guys all know the drill by now, but just a reminder that everyone is responsible for their own safety at the pub and so do take the usual precautions before attending.

name: FULL - Picnic, Park & Pints - London 20s and 30s Social
description:
**Summer is well and truly here, and we thought what better way to celebrate the long bank holiday weekend than our very first picnic for London 20s and 30s.**

Yep, we’ll be making the most of the free Friday, getting the drinks flowing, the tunes and enjoying some fun in the sun.

The picnic will take place in Regent’s Park from 2pm, and over the course of the afternoon, as well as enjoying some drinks and plenty of snacks.

On top of this, for those who want wish to do so, there will be an option of playing a selection of park and outdoor games, such as boules, badminton, frisbee and possibly rounders.

Of course, like with all our events - you’ll have plenty of chance to chat, chill and get to know other 20s and 30s.

We aren’t limited by space for this event, but we will be capping numbers so as to keep the group size manageable and intimate.

And so do make sure you nab your place as soon as you can - as we will be having to turn off RSVPS when we’re nearing the capacity limit.

\- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \-

**WHERE/WHEN WE WILL MEET**

**Meet Point -** We will be meeting on the grass, outside the Hub in Regent’s Park from 2pm. (Exact Location: [https://goo.gl/maps/j3XJ8eP1zSYnSEeU7](https://goo.gl/maps/j3XJ8eP1zSYnSEeU7))

**Closest stations -** St John’s Wood, Baker Street, Regents Park (Each 15 mins walk approx)

**Start Time -** 2:00pm

**Finish time:** 7:00pm (approx, although you’re welcome to stay as long as you wish)

name: FULL - Virtual Reality, Karaoke & Arcade - 20s & 30s Bank Holiday Social
description:
**The long Platinum Jubilee bank holiday is coming and to mark the first night of this special 4 Day Weekend, we’ve planned for you a special visit to one of the most famous activity bars in London.**

Yep there’s no work in the morning and so for this social, we’ll be making Wednesday the new Friday - with a whole evening of games and entertainment organised for you at the popular Clapham pub, Four Thieves.

Most notably, we’ve booked out several virtual reality booths for you to play and compete at a range of immersive games against your fellow 20s and 30s.

The pub not only offers virtual reality but also a huge range of activities from crazy golf, retro arcade games (including some that you can play on a big screen), carnival-style games, table football, pinball and even a karaoke room!

It is also one of the few places in the country with a big remote control car race track in the middle of the venue.

The Moonshine Raceway allows up to ten players to race against each over 20 frantic laps, with participant having their own steering wheel and pedals to simulate a real driving experience. The race even has its own live scoreboard and commentator to intensify the drama.

And so on the day, we will be having a series of races against one another and hopefully working out who is the secret formula one driver amongst us.

To top of all that competitive fun, over the course of the night - you'll of course have plenty of opportunity to meet and connect with other Londoners in their 20s and 30.

\- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \-

**HOW IT WORKS**

The group will meet from 6:30pm at the main bar in Four Thieves where you can get a drink and meet the group, before our time in the VR booths formally begins at 7:00pm.

We will be taking turns in the virtual reality arena from 7pm till close, and between each go - we will be having a number of races on the Moonshine Raceway, as well as enjoying all the activities the pub has to offer and of course, having a few drinks.

When the drinks have well and truly started to flow, there will be then be opportunity for some late night karaoke in one of their private karaoke rooms.

\- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \-

**ATTENDANCE FEE**

Attendance for the night is £15 and this covers the cost of your VR experience for the evening and we've booked 2 hours in a karaoke room for you as well.

Unfortunately these places are very limited and will be offered on a first come, first serve basis. So if you are keen to join, please do RSVP as soon as you can. Hopefully see you there!

\- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \-

**WHERE/WHEN**

This social night will take place at the following address:

Address: Four Thieves, 51 Lavender Gardens, London SW11 1DJ (Location here: [https://g.page/FourThievesPub?share](https://g.page/FourThievesPub?share))

Nearest Tube Stations: Clapham Junction (10 min walk), Clapham Common (10 min walk)

Start Time: 7:00 PM

End Time: 11:45 PM

name: Free Social Walk, Games & Pub - Wanstead Park
description:
**We're back! And this time heading back to the East of London for our next social walk for London 20s and 30s.**

For this latest walk, we’ll be visiting this lesser-known but beautiful park in North East London, Wanstead Park.

We will be starting out the hike from George Green, opposite Wanstead Station (on the Central Line).

From there, we will walk together to the park which forms part of Epping Forest and wander around the beautiful 18th century ornamental lakes and bluebell meadows.

We will stop throughout the walk for some team games and for a chance to mix up the groups and get to know other people.

After this, we will walk across the wide open Wanstead Flats before ending at The Rookwood Village Pub in Forest Gate where you can grab a drink, play some games and get to know your fellow hikers a bit better.

The walk is roughly 2-3 hours long and a little bit more mixed-terrain than usual so not suitable for bikes this time, sorry!

Please also note that if it's been raining recently the park can get muddy so please wear appropriate footwear.

**As with all our social walks, the afternoon will feature:**

* A Range of Fun, Games and Entertainment
* Speed Friending Activities
* Expert Games Host and Walk Guide
* Plenty of Like-Minded 20s to 30s
* The Great Outdoors and Stunning Scenery
* A Trip to the Pub (Optional but highly recommended!)

Unfortunately owing to the size of the venue, we will be having to cap numbers for this event.

And so do make sure you nab your place as soon as you can - as we will be having to turn off RSVPS when we’re nearing the capacity limit.

**HOW IT WORKS**

We will be meeting on the grass opposite the Belgique Wanstead Cafe on the edge of George Green at 2pm.

To start the event, you will be allocated a group/team for an initial mix of fun ice breaker games designed to get people talking and help you to get to know some of the other participants on the walk a little better.

After the games, we will commence our walk around Wanstead Park. Along the way, there will be a number of pit-stops, where we will rotate the groups and play more social games.

After a few hours of nature, getting to know each other and working up a thirst, we'll head to a local pub and have a couple of drinks.

**WHERE/WHEN WE WILL MEET**

Meet Point - George Green - On the grass opposite the **Belgique Wanstead Cafe**, 29 Cambridge Park, London E11 2P (See location: [https://g.page/BelgiqueCafe?share](https://g.page/BelgiqueCafe?share))

Closest stations: Wanstead (5 mins walk)

Destination: The Rookwood Village, Forest Gate

Meet Time - 2:00pm (We will be leaving at 2:10pm, so don't be late!)

Finish time: 5:00pm

Pub Finish time: 7:00pm-8:30pm (Approx)

**WHAT TO BRING**

* Hiking shoes, boots or other suitable footwear
* Good Waterproof jacket and trousers (in case it rains!)
* Warm/Windproof layer (as it's London)
* Camera & phone
* Snacks
* Face mask, Hand Sanitizer etc.

**HEALTH AND SAFETY**

I'm sure you guys all know the drill by now, but just a reminder that everyone is responsible for their own safety on the walk and at the pub!

Finally, the pub element is optional and so if you’d prefer not to head off following the walk, then no worries at all!

name: Drink and Do - Pottery, Arts and Crafts Social
description:
**After being a huge hit several weeks ago, we're pleased to announce that on Friday 27th May, we'll be once again hosting our popular Drink and Do Social for London 20s and 30s.**

For this, we'll be returning to the newly opened ArtPlay in Liverpool Street for an evening of arts, crafts and social drinks.

We’ve booked out the entire venue just for you guys and they’ve kindly agreed to line up a whole host of activities, so that you’ll have opportunity to try a range of crafts such as pottery, painting, flower pressing and decoupage.

The theme of the evening will be Enchanted Forest and the venue will be providing all the artistic tools and materials you’ll need to paint your own enchanted forest masterpiece or design everything from your own miniature garden to pottery mushrooms/toadstools.

And you will get to take home whatever you design or create on the night for no additional fee.

There will also prosecco, wine and beer available to buy on the night, so you can drink while you paint, craft and design.

As with all our events, the evening of arts and crafts will of course provide plenty of chance for you to chat and connect with other 20s and 30s.

The evening will run from 7:30pm till 10pm but for those who want to, there will also be option to go out for more Friday Night drinks in Shoreditch.

Unfortunately owing to the size of the venue, we can only accommodate a small number of people for this particular event.

And so do make sure you nab your place as soon as you can - as we will be having to turn off RSVPS when we’ve reached the capacity limit.

**WHERE/WHEN WE WILL MEET**

Venue - Art Play, 56 Middlesex St, London E1 7EZ (see location: [https://goo.gl/maps/m8NdqsZHnve4Qj3E8](https://goo.gl/maps/m8NdqsZHnve4Qj3E8))

Closest stations: Liverpool Street (5 min walk)

Finish time: 10:00pm

**ATTENDANCE FEE**

Attendance for the night is £15 and this includes all of the materials you’ll need to create your designs.

Unfortunately these places are very limited and will be offered on a first come, first serve basis. So if you are keen to join, please do RSVP as soon as you can!

name: FREE Board Games Night - London 20s and 30s
description:
**On Wednesday 25th May, we're delighted to be hosting our next FREE Board Games Night for London 20s and 30s.**

We’ll be heading to the Blighty café in North London to enjoy a large selection of board games and have a pint or a cocktail or two!

We will be providing a selection of board games for you to play during the board games night, but you’re more than welcome to bring your own too!

We have booked out a big space at the café and so you will hopefully get to play many games throughout the evening and meet many wonderful Londoners in their 20s and 30s.

So if you're looking to play some games, meet new people, and have a laugh then we'd love to have you.

**\- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \-**

**THE GAMES**

To keep the games as inclusive and accessible as possible for everyone, we tend to encourage groups to play one of a considerable number of easy-to-play party or social board games that we will be offering.

On top of this, to ensure you get plenty of chances to meet other 20s and 30s over the course of the evening, we like to rotate the groups and so we tend not to encourage longer games.

To ensure that everyone has a great time, please let the organiser know if you are bringing your own games before the event or when you arrive at the event.

description:
**It’s here. It’s landed. Another Sunday and we’ve got you covered once again with yet another new Social Walk and Pub trip for London 20s and 30s.**

For our latest 20s and 30s walk, we’ll be visiting one of the most stunning parks and walking spots in London, Greenwich Park.

We will be starting out the walk in the green bushy pastures of Blackheath. From there, we will wander into Greenwich Park where we’ll take in some of the most famous views overlooking London and the Old Royal Observatory.

After taking in the sights, we will then venture past the historic sailing ship, the Cutty Sark, through the Greenwich Foot Tunnel and along the canals of the Isle of Dogs.

We will then finish up at the Star of the East pub in Canary Wharf where you can grab a drink, play some games and get to know your fellow hikers a bit better.

**As with all our social walks, the afternoon will feature:**

After the games, we will commence our walk to Canary Wharf. Along the way, there will be a number of pit-stops, where we will rotate the groups and play more social games.

To start off the hike, we will be wandering past the Palace grounds taking in its lavish gardens, elegant cobbled courtyards and magnificent Tudor architecture.

From there, we will wander through the Royal Paddocks, then along the River Thames past Teddington and Strawberry Hill and eventually ending up at Richmond.

We will then finish up at the Rose of York pub in Richmond where you can grab a drink, play some games and get to know your fellow hikers a bit better.

We will be starting out the hike from Rotary Gardens by the river in Richmond. From there, we will wander along the river and then into the famous royal park, with its wide open spaces and stunning grasslands.

The walk is roughly 2-3 hours long and the park is renown as a wildlife sanctuary and the park's resident deer herds are often spotted along the way.

We will then cross into Putney Heath and finish up at the Green Man in Putney where you can grab a drink, play some games and get to know your fellow hikers a bit better.

description:
**On Tuesday 3rd May, we are hugely excited to be hosting a brand new and exclusive evening for London 20s and 30s.**

For this social, we've booked out several booths at the most popular virtual clay target shooting activity bar, Clays in Moorgate.

Each booth has its own set of rifles and high tech equipment has been inbuilt to provide a fun and realistic clay shooting experience.

As part of the experience, as well as enjoying a drink or two - you can compete in a whole bunch of clay shooting games played on huge screens.

These games range from a basic clay shooting game (with different colours, speeds, etc.), a peloton style bike race (where the more you hit, the faster you go), to "Bonanza", where the clays veer wildly around the screen, and lets you smash down another player's points total by hitting occasional trick target.

As well as this competitive fun, over the course of the night - you'll have plenty opportunity to meet, connect with with other Londoners in their 20s and 30.

**HOW IT WORKS**

The group will meet at 7:30pm at the main bar in Clays where you can get a drink and meet the group, before our time in the booths formally begins at 8:00pm

We will then have 90 minutes of competitive shooting action. After which, we will continue the night either in the main bar or explore the local bars in Moorgate, depending on the wish of the group.

\- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \-

**ATTENDANCE FEE**

Attendance for the night is £7.50 and this includes all of the above.

Unfortunately these places are very limited and will be offered on a first come, first serve basis. So if you are keen to join, please do RSVP as soon as you can!

Hopefully see you there!

\- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \-

**WHERE/WHEN**

This social night will take place at the following address:

Address: Clays Bar, 55 Moorgate, London EC2R 6LL (https://goo.gl/maps/vhTweWuL5PRVQeBu5)

Nearest Tube Stations: Moorgate (5 min walk)

Start Time: 7:30 PM

End Time: 10:30 PM

name: Free Social Walk, Games and Pub Quiz - Royal Parks (Central London)
description:
**It's back and this one will be bigger than ever! On Sunday 1st May, we're really excited to once again be hosting a FREE Social Walk and Pub Quiz for 20s and 30s in the very heart of Central London.**

For this special social hike, we will be once again be walking through all three Royal Parks, starting at Hyde Park through Green Park and finally, St James Park.

Along the way, we'll be flying past some of the most famous landmarks and sights of London, like Big Ben and the Houses of Parliament. We will then cross Westminster Bridge and end up in Waterloo.

This walk will be made extra special as following the walk, we'll be hosting our monthly creative and quirky pub quiz for you to enjoy.

As always, on the walk we will be playing a series of fun and entertaining ice breaker games designed to help you meet and hopefully have a bit of a laugh with your fellow hikers.

The event will feature:

* A Range of Fun, Games and Entertainment
* Speed Friending Activities
* Expert Games Host and Walk Guide
* Plenty of Like-Minded 20s to 30s
* The Great Outdoors and Stunning Scenery
* A Trip to the Pub
* Social Pub Quiz with prizes

**HOW IT WORKS**

The walk will start from Hyde Park, by the Kensington Gardens Bandstand.

To start the event, you will be allocated a group/team for an initial mix of fun ice breaker games designed to get people talking and help you to get to know some of the other participants on the walk a little better.

Throughout the walk from Hyde Park to Waterloo, there will be a number of pit-stops (approx every 30-40 mins) to enable for everyone to catch up, play some more social games and allow us to rotate the groups, so you don’t end up talking to the same people for the entire walk.

We've booked out a large number of tables at the pub, so that you can get your quiz on, put your feet up, grab food and have a drink or two with your fellow hikers. After the quiz, we also provide cards and games for those who want to keep up that competitive spirit.

**WHERE/WHEN WE WILL MEET**

Meet Point - Kensington Gardens Bandstand ([https://goo.gl/maps/hS9T58cpHr1EFAtp8](https://goo.gl/maps/hS9T58cpHr1EFAtp8))

Closest tube stations: High Street Kensington (10 Min walk), Gloucester Road (15 min walk), South Kensington (15 min walk)

Destination: Thirsty Bear, Waterloo

Meet Time - 14:00pm (we will leave promptly, so don't be late!)

Walk Finish time: 17:00 (approx)

Pub Finish time: 18:30pm (approx)

**WHAT TO BRING**

* Hiking shoes, boots or other suitable footwear
* Good Waterproof jacket and trousers (in case it rains!)
* Warm/Windproof layer (as it's London)
* Camera & phone
* Snacks
* Face mask, Hand Sanitizer etc.

**HEALTH AND SAFETY**

I'm sure you guys all know the drill by now, but just a reminder that everyone is responsible for their own safety on the walk and at the pub!

Finally, the pub element is optional and so if you’d prefer to head off following the walk, then no worries at all!

name: London 20s and 30s Pub Social - Central London
description:
**On Friday 29th April, we are excited to once again be hosting our exclusive and always memorable, Pub Social for London 20s and 30s.**

Yep, no games, no organised fun or activities - just a space for you to chat and connect with other 20s and 30s and have a few drinks.

For this, we’ve booked out an area at a lively and central pub in London Bridge, the George Inn from 7pm.

Whether you are new to our 20s and 30s events or a seasoned veteran, you are very welcome to join us to meet or get to know some of our community better and let off some steam after a long working week.

Whilst we have a fairly big space, we do unfortunately have to cap numbers when they get too high.

And so do make sure you nab your place as soon as you can - as we will be having to turn off RSVPS when it looks as though we’re approaching our capacity limit.

**WHERE/WHEN WE WILL MEET**

Venue - The George Inn, 75 Borough High St, London SE1 1NH

Closest Tube stations: London Bridge (3 Min Walk), Borough (5 Min Walk), Monument (10 Min Walk)

Location: [https://g.page/george-pub-southwark](https://g.page/george-pub-southwark)

Meet Time - 7:00pm

Finish time: 11:45pm

**HEALTH AND SAFETY**

I'm sure you guys all know the drill by now, but just a reminder that everyone is responsible for their own safety at the pub and so do take the usual precautions before attending.

name: FREE Board Games Night - London 20s and 30s
description:
**On Wednesday 27th April, we're delighted to be hosting our next FREE Board Games Night for London 20s and 30s.**

As previously, we’ll be heading to the Loading Bar in North London to enjoy a huge selection of board games, free to play video games, and have a pint or a cocktail or two!

The pub offers a range of activities to keep you busy including 80+ Board Games, Xbox One, PS4, N64, Nintendo Switches, Arcade Games, Pinball and Table Football.

We have booked out a big space in the pub and so you will hopefully get a chance to compete in a variety of different games over the course of the evening, as well as of course chance to get to speak to and connect with plenty of other Londoners in their 20s and 30s.

This event is open to everyone - whether this is your first time playing board games or your 100th! And so if you're looking to play some games, meet new people, and have a laugh then we'd love to have you.

Hopefully see you there!

\- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \-

**WHERE/WHEN**

We've booked out a large space in the Loading Bar in Stoke Newington.

Address: Loading Bar, 129 Stoke Newington High St, London, N16 0PH (Location: [https://g.page/loadingdalston?share](https://g.page/loadingdalston?share))

Nearest Tube Station: Stoke Newington Overground (approx 5 min walk)

Start Time: 7:00 PM

End Time: 10:30 PM

name: Free Social Walk, Games & Pub - River Wandle (Morden Park to Wandsworth)
description:
**The Easter Holidays may be over, but don’t worry - once again, we’ve got your weekend sorted with yet another special social walk, games and pub trip on Sunday 24th April.**

For their latest 20s and 30s walk, we’ll be starting out the hike from Morden Park. From there, we will venture up the River Wandle, through Earlsfield and King George’s Park.

The walk will then finish up at the Ram pub in Wandsworth where you can grab a drink, play some games and get to know your fellow hikers a bit better.

Rather sadly, this old pub will actually be closing its doors for the final time the very next day following our visit.

But to go out with a bang, the pub has kindly offered to provide free nachos, as well as opening up their popular taco van for those who would like to eat.

You will also be able to play a game or two of floor Shuffleboard in their upstairs games area.

**As with all our social walks, the afternoon will feature:**

* A Range of Fun, Games and Entertainment
* Speed Friending Activities
* Expert Games Host and Walk Guide
* Plenty of Like-Minded 20s to 30s
* The Great Outdoors and Stunning Scenery
* A Trip to the Pub (Optional but highly recommended!)

Unfortunately owing to the size of the venue, we will be having to cap numbers for this event.

And so do make sure you nab your place as soon as you can - as we will be having to turn off RSVPS when we’re nearing the capacity limit.

**HOW IT WORKS**

We will be meeting in Morden Hall Park (by the bridge) at 2:00pm.

To start the event, you will be allocated a group/team for an initial mix of fun ice breaker games designed to get people talking and help you to get to know some of the other participants on the walk a little better.

After the games, we will commence our 2-3 hour walk around the Heath. Along the way, there will be a number of pit-stops (approx every 30-40 mins) where we will rotate the groups and play more social games.

After a few hours of nature, getting to know each other and working up a thirst, we'll head to a local pub and have a couple of drinks.

**WHERE/WHEN WE WILL MEET**

Meet Point - Morden Hall Park Bridge, Morden SM4 5JA (see location: https://goo.gl/maps/fU9NX97j59oBdvNn6)

Closest stations: Morden (5-10 min walk)

Destination: The Ram, Wandsworth

Meet Time - 2:00pm (We will be leaving at 2:10pm, so don't be late!)

Finish time: 5:00pm

Pub Finish time: 7:00pm-8:30pm (Approx)

**WHAT TO BRING**

* Hiking shoes, boots or other suitable footwear
* Good Waterproof jacket and trousers (in case it rains!)
* Warm/Windproof layer (as it's London)
* Camera & phone
* Snacks
* Face mask, Hand Sanitizer etc.

**HEALTH AND SAFETY**

I'm sure you guys all know the drill by now, but just a reminder that everyone is responsible for their own safety on the walk and at the pub!

Finally, the pub element is optional and so if you’d prefer not to head off following the walk, then no worries at all!

name: The Great London Easter Egg Hunt - London 20s and 30s
description:
**Spring is in the air and Easter is here! And to mark the occasion as opposed to our usual weekly walk, we’ve got something extra special for you… our very first Great London Easter Egg Hunt for 20s and 30s.**

Taking place across two of the most beautiful spots in London, Primrose Hill and Regent’s Park, the event combines a traditional treasure hunt (with clues), with a number of social and exhilarating games and challenges.

All of which is designed to help you have a memorable afternoon and provide you with plenty of chance to connect with other Londoners in their 20s and 30s.

To up the stakes, there will be plenty of chocolate easter egg prizes up for grabs for the winners of the hunts (as no Easter would be complete without them!)

As always, we will be ending up at a pub where you'll be able to relax, have a drink with those you've met on the hunt and play some games.

\* Easter Egg Hunts and Races
\* Games, Challenges and Activities
\* Expert Games Host
\* Plenty of Like-Minded 20s to 30s
\* The Great Outdoors and Some Stunning Scenery
\* A Trip to the Pub (Optional but highly recommended!)

**HOW IT WORKS**

The event will start with a warm-up Easter Egg Race in Regent’s Park.

Teams will compete against each other to find as many chocolate eggs as they can within a set time period. (Yes, you will of course get to keep any eggs you find!)

After the winning team has been crowned champion and the ground rules have been explained, we will then move onto the main Easter Egg hunt.

For this, your team will get a series of clues that you’ll have to decrypt to find 18 secret locations.

When you have successfully found a secret location, you will then have a task or challenge to complete, that is designed to test your ingenuity, creativity, bravery and team work.

You will be competing other teams to find all the secret locations and complete all the challenges as fast as you can.

Because as soon as you have completed all the challenges and send your proof of completion, you will then be given the final clue where the treasure lies.

Although, you better be quick in finding the treasure as you will only have a 5 minute head start to find the prize.

As after 5 minutes, this clue will be revealed to the rest of the teams and it will turns into free-for-all to win the ultimate prize.

After the event, as is standard - we will head to a local pub, where you can have a couple of drinks with others on the hunt, get food (if you want it) and play some games.

BUT THAT’S NOT ALL.

The competition is not just about speed but also about creativity and ingenuity.

And so when the game is up, all the teams must submit their efforts and the tasks will be judged, with yet further prizes going for best submissions (most creative, most entertaining etc).

**WHERE/WHEN WE WILL MEET**

Meet Point - Regent’s Park Bandstand, (Exact Location - https://goo.gl/maps/25hxzBBDhqco35e38)

Closest Tube stations: Mornington Crescent, Great Portland Street, Camden Town

Destination: The Albert, Primrose Hill

Meet Time - 2:30pm (The hunt will start at 2:40pm, so don't be late!)

Finish time: 5:30pm

Pub Finish time: 7:00pm-8:30pm (Approx)

**WHAT TO BRING**

\* Hiking shoes, boots or other suitable footwear
\* Good Waterproof jacket and trousers (in case it rains!)
\* Warm/Windproof layer (as it's London)
\* Camera & phone
\* Snacks
\* Face mask, Hand Sanitizer etc.

**HEALTH AND SAFETY**

I'm sure you guys all know the drill by now, but just a reminder that everyone is responsible for their own safety on the walk and at the pub!

Finally, the pub element is optional and so if you’d prefer not to head off following the walk, then no worries at all!

**ATTENDANCE FEE**

We typically don’t like to charge for our events - but given the limited space at the venue we have booked for this event and to cover the costs of prizes, we will be charging a very small fee of £2 for attending.

This is also partly to ensure that we only get people RSVPing who are genuinely keen to join us for the evening, rather than any flaky serial RSVPers who just wanna snap up a space!

For this latest free social walk, we’ll be rambling across the green pastures of Hampstead Heath in North London.

Along the way, we will rambling past the stately home, Kenwood House and the famous Parliament Hill viewing point overlooking London.

As always, we will be ending up at a pub where you'll be able to relax, have a drink with those you've met on the walk and play some games. As with all our social walks, the event will feature:

name: 20s & 30s Ballie Ballerson Social | Epic Adult Playground
description:
**On Wednesday 6th April, we are hugely excited to be hosting a brand new and exclusive evening for London 20s and 30s.**

For this social, we’ll be visiting one of the most popular yet unique bars in London, the famous Ballie Ballerson in Shoreditch.

With two giant ball pits, retro cocktails, pizza and some great music, it truly is the ultimate adult playground and the perfect way to let loose during the week and reminisce on your childhood.

More importantly, over the course of the night - it’ll be a great opportunity to meet, connect with and have a bit of nostalgic fun with other Londoners in their 20s and 30.

The group will meet at 7:00pm in the main bar at Ballie Ballerson, where you can get a drink and play a few quick warm-up games before our time in the ball begins at 7:30pm.

We will then have 2 hours in the ball pit to unlock our inner child, swim through seas of plastic balls and probably eventually, start a full on ball pit war.

Following the adrenaline fuelled session - at 9:30pm, we will continue the night either to the main bar or explore the local Shoreditch bars for a drink or two, depending on the wishes of the group.

\- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \-

**HOW TO BOOK**

Attendance for the night is £5.50 and this includes all of the above.

**To book your place, you will need to not just RSVP, but also purchase your ticket here: [https://shoreditch.ballieballerson.com/baller-tickets/](https://shoreditch.ballieballerson.com/baller-tickets/)**

Please ensure you select the right date and time slot: **Wednesday 6th April - 7:30pm-9:30pm**

We understand these are very limited and will be offered on a first come, first serve basis. So if you are keen to join, please do get a ticket and RSVP as soon as you can!

Hopefully see you there!

\- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \-

**WHERE/WHEN**

This social night will take place at the following address:

Address: Ballie Ballerson,[masked] Curtain Rd, London EC2A 3BS (Location: https://g.page/BallieBallersonShoreditch?share)

Nearest Tube Stations: Old Street and Shoreditch High Street (approx 5 min walk)

Start Time: 7:00 PM

End Time: 10:30 PM

For this latest free social walk, we’ve got a great hike lined up from Wandsworth to Battersea.

As part of this, we’ll be wandering through the green pastures of Wandsworth Common, then down the river thames to Battersea Park.

Finally, after a wander through the park and past the famous London Peace Pagoda, we will be ending up at an amazing (covered) pub garden in Battersea for a drink, food and games.

name: War Meet - Open Gaming  - Wednesdays @ Bad Moon
description:
**HOW IT WORKS:**

name: Dungeons & Dragons - Londinium Casual 'drop in' Campaign Session
description:
Welcome to the LWG Casual D&D Campaign! Going forward, we will schedule in-person sessions at Seven Dials on Mondays, and continue our Online sessions on Tuesdays, where DM & player interest is there!

From first timers to veterans, drop in to any sessions you want. We'll sort you into groups in the text below approx 24 hours before the session starts, and get you started on a one-shot adventure that fits into our campaign setting.

What is it?
Casual drop-in games set in the same world with an over-arching story. Play as much and whenever you like! Never played? No problem! Arrive early and we'll help you build a character, or we have a few set ones you can borrow.

What Do I Bring?
Pencil & paper, character sheet, dice, Player's Handbook & any other source books your character uses.

NEW PLAYERS:
You can make a level 2 character (PHB+1) and jump right in. Let your DM know you're new. If you need help with creating a character, reach out to any DM or Admin in our Whatsapp chat or Discord ( https://discord.gg/Dg2BeDR ), we're happy to help you along!

MORE INFO:
https://drive.google.com/open?id=1s22yxbraAcz53UcUE1iM8WhMeTIcRQWB

Arrival: 6:30 - 7pm.
Adventure!: 7-10pm
After session social: 10-11pm.
Please do be a few minutes early, as we MUST start at 7pm sharp!

NB: The London Wargaming Guild is a non-profit, and is entirely volunteer-run. All fees charged go towards the running costs of the Guild (mostly venue rents) - every penny!

Thus, organisers and DMs do not get paid for their time. We do it because we enjoy it, and because we love the community in the Guild - and we hope you will too!

name: Warhammer 40K Combat Patrol Tournament - 500pts
description:
Our Combat Patrol event is back!

Come along and play four fast-paced games using our custom format and missions. You only need 500 points, with £100 worth of prizes being up for grabs!

It's a perfect opportunity to paint up some new models, try out a new army, or just come along and meet some great people.

The event will feature a custom mission pack which you can find below, please email your list to [masked].

++++ PACK ++++

The pack and Missions can be accessed here:

[Event Pack](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1prFW5KAz56bTJ9RhkuDyYKvluwpvi6PX/view?usp=sharing)

[Missions](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1-5ZUn78LdjZqNuJp2hrSuYyh9xNTSjMM/view?usp=sharing)

++++++++

EVENT ESSENTIALS
Entry Price: £20
Army Size: 500 points
Number of games: 4
Army Selection: Custom – see pack above
Missions in use: Custom – see pack above
Prizes!

**Timeline:**
**09:00 – Arrive/set-up**
**09:30 – Round 1 (1 hr 20 mins)**
**10:50 – Break (20 mins)**
**11:10 – Round 2 (1hr 20 min)**
**12:30 – Lunch (60 mins)**
**13:30 – Round 3 (1hr 20 min)**
**14:50 – Break (20 mins)**
**15:10 – Round 4 (1hr 20 min)**
**16:30 – Pack Up**
**17:00 – Winners announced and prizes handed out**
**17:20 – End**

name: SAGA Saturday Games Day!
description:
Exciting day at Seven Dials this Saturday as the ancient world comes to life.

An all day SAGA event has been planned with the historical section of the club.

Full event £15pp

name: DBL 22 - Draft Night
description:
New season, new life! DBL 22 will be London's biggest Blood Bowl League, and that requires a suitably epic kick-off!

DBL Draft night will see us draw all of our coaches and their teams into their conferences for the season ahead, and it will also be our first match night of the season. We will also be celebrating some of our DBL veterans and making a few key announcements for the season ahead. So whether you want to come along for the Blood Bowl or just to enjoy the proceedings, all are welcome.

Please only sign-up for this event once your League application has been confirmed after sign-up night on 2 June. When you sign up please indicate if you want to play on the night (please pay the standard £4 table fee) or just spectate/drink heavily (FREE-ish!)

**The Location:** The event is held at the Bad Moon Cafe. The venue offers barista coffee, craft beer, wood-fired pizza, and a large stock of Games Workshop and board game products for purchase.

Can cater to pretty much any game you care to play including 40k, 9th Age, AOS, X-wing, Mordheim, Battle Fleet Gothic, Blood Bowl, Chess?

Beginners are more than welcome, we've got a mixed bag when it comes to levels of experience and we're all open to teaching the rules to any keen new kid on the block.

name: [Online] Dungeons & Dragons - Londinium Casual 'drop in' Campaign Session
description:
Welcome to the LWG Casual D&D Campaign! We are currently running in-person sessions in Central London on Mondays, and online sessions on Tuesdays! This meetup is for an ONLINE session!

From first timers to veterans, drop in to any sessions you want. We'll sort you into groups in the text below approx 24 hours before the session starts, and get you started on a one-shot adventure that fits into our campaign setting. We do most of our organising in our WhatsApp, including sharing links to join games. Keep an eye on the Whatsapp in the hour before your game starts!

We don't share WhatsApp links publicly. If you're not in the WhatsApp, ask for an invite on our Discord https://discord.gg/Dg2BeDR

Our DMs all run games differently, so please be prepared to be flexible. Most use Roll20 and Discord, but some might use other platforms like VTT and Googlemeets. Our DMs also all run different styles of game - Theatre of the Mind vs Battlemaps, Heavy Roleplay vs Heavy Combat, etc - please be prepared to roll with that too!

If possible, please have to hand: A headset with mic (Echoes are mood-killers!) A webcam (It's a social game, and it helps if we can see each other!) A shareable character sheet Dice for physical rolling (some DMs are very trusting!)

NEW PLAYERS: What is it? Casual drop-in games set in the same world with an over-arching story. Play as much and whenever you like! Never played? No problem! You can make a level 2 character (PHB+1) and jump right in. If you reach out to any DM or in our Whatsapp chat, we're happy to help you along! More detailed rules available here: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1gMcoIAR0v6PJ78qdTsOzM3TdJ8aFGrhE/view?usp=sharing

Due to limited spaces, players are limited to one session a week (not including any Saturday sessions).

Setup: 6:45 - 7:00 pm
Adventure!: 7:00-10:30 pm Please be online a few minutes early, as we MUST start at 7pm sharp!

NB: The London Wargaming Guild is a non-profit, and is entirely volunteer-run. All fees charged go towards the running costs of the Guild (mostly venue rents) - every penny!

Thus, organisers and DMs do not get paid for their time. We do it because we enjoy it, and because we love the community in the Guild - and we hope you will too!

name: Dungeons & Dragons - Londinium Casual 'drop in' Campaign Session
description:
Welcome to the LWG Casual D&D Campaign! Going forward, we will schedule in-person sessions at Seven Dials on Mondays, and continue our Online sessions on Tuesdays, where DM & player interest is there!

From first timers to veterans, drop in to any sessions you want. We'll sort you into groups in the text below approx 24 hours before the session starts, and get you started on a one-shot adventure that fits into our campaign setting.

What is it?
Casual drop-in games set in the same world with an over-arching story. Play as much and whenever you like! Never played? No problem! Arrive early and we'll help you build a character, or we have a few set ones you can borrow.

What Do I Bring?
Pencil & paper, character sheet, dice, Player's Handbook & any other source books your character uses.

NEW PLAYERS:
You can make a level 2 character (PHB+1) and jump right in. Let your DM know you're new. If you need help with creating a character, reach out to any DM or Admin in our Whatsapp chat or Discord ( https://discord.gg/Dg2BeDR ), we're happy to help you along!

MORE INFO:
https://drive.google.com/open?id=1s22yxbraAcz53UcUE1iM8WhMeTIcRQWB

Arrival: 6:30 - 7pm.
Adventure!: 7-10pm
After session social: 10-11pm.
Please do be a few minutes early, as we MUST start at 7pm sharp!

NB: The London Wargaming Guild is a non-profit, and is entirely volunteer-run. All fees charged go towards the running costs of the Guild (mostly venue rents) - every penny!

Thus, organisers and DMs do not get paid for their time. We do it because we enjoy it, and because we love the community in the Guild - and we hope you will too!
