name: LWG Kill Team Series - Season 6 Teams Tournament
description:
In order to ensure an even number of teams on the day we are now only accepting teams in groups of 2. If you're interested in taking part please leave a comment below.

**Season 6**

Welcome to Season 6 of the LWG Kill Team Series! Teams of three people will battle it out over the course of three competitive games. Each faction can only be represented once within each team.

Event pack can be found here: https://drive.google.com/file/d/16MQERPeXpGhVCI3cKYhJupN5iywIL2_P/view?usp=sharing

**Signups**

Players should organise their 3-person teams themselves. Then one member of the team can RSVP on behalf of the team. The cost to enter is £45 per team.

**Painting Requirements**

There are no painting requirements for this tournament. Given this please note victory points for having a painted roster will not be in effect for this tournament - accordingly players can score a maximum of 18 points in a mission.

Conversions and 3rd party miniatures are accepted as long as they can be matched to the appropriate entry on the roster.

**Roster submission**

Captains should ensure all teammates have submitted a text version of their roster online by 10pm Saturday 4th June, through the event listing on the Best Coast Pairings app (BCP), using the same email you used when purchasing your ticket, in addition to bringing a hard copy to the event to show your opponents. A guide to using the BCP app can be found [HERE](https://bestcoastpairings.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/360018232572-Getting-Started-with-the-Player-App)

**Event Schedule**

*Please note round times include 15 mins at the start for pairings*

Registration 9:00 – 9:30

Round 1 9:30 – 11:30

Lunch 11:30 – 12:30

Round 2 12:30 – 14:30

Round 3 14:30 – 16:30

Awards 16:30 – 16:45

**FAQ**

We will be using the LWG London FAQ found here: https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1B6QChI38PWfeC5Oy2FaFLa0hrL2IYNyMei_b9x5mMBE/edit?usp=sharing

name: MESBG - Pair Tournament
description:
Hi Everyone,

With the unfortunate cancelling of Fantasy Fellowship I bring exciting news.
A tournament on the 11th of June!
Plain 600 points of Good vs Evil but with a twist.
Whilst not doubles you will need to find yourself a partner as you compete in teams of two against other teams.
Details are in the pack but as a TLDR:
One person brings a 600 point good army, the other a 600 point evil army.
As a pair you get ranked together and always face off against another pair.

Pack: https://docs.google.com/document/d/10CQnp1mmK5iKwHJF27e383RRn7UJe3zDuPXWvQGSA8s/edit#

name: LWG Historical Games Day
description: LWG Saturday games day for our historical community!

name: Dungeons & Dragons - Londinium Casual 'drop in' Campaign Session
description:
Welcome to the LWG Casual D&D Campaign! Going forward, we will schedule in-person sessions at Seven Dials on Mondays, and continue our Online sessions on Tuesdays, where DM & player interest is there!

From first timers to veterans, drop in to any sessions you want. We'll sort you into groups in the text below approx 24 hours before the session starts, and get you started on a one-shot adventure that fits into our campaign setting.

What is it?
Casual drop-in games set in the same world with an over-arching story. Play as much and whenever you like! Never played? No problem! Arrive early and we'll help you build a character, or we have a few set ones you can borrow.

What Do I Bring?
Pencil & paper, character sheet, dice, Player's Handbook & any other source books your character uses.

NEW PLAYERS:
You can make a level 2 character (PHB+1) and jump right in. Let your DM know you're new. If you need help with creating a character, reach out to any DM or Admin in our Whatsapp chat or Discord ( https://discord.gg/Dg2BeDR ), we're happy to help you along!

name: Crusade Narrative Day
description:
Let's get some 40K going! We'll try and run a big narrative battle (maybe a spin on apocalypse) - or perhaps using one of the custom Crusade mission books

Details of matchups tbc, depending on who signs up.

name: Saturday Games Day! - Jubilee Joust! - Just £7 for all day gaming + free raffle!
description:
Special Price: £7 for the Queens 70 year Jubilee

Exciting day at Seven Dials this Saturday, with several systems hosting their own events. This MeetUp is for people who want to come along and play a game of their choice.

To honour the Queens 70th Jubilee, we have reduced ticket price to £7 for the full day gaming. Additionally, each attendee will be entered into a raffle for a £70 Voucher!

All members welcome to come down and socialise.

name: War Meet - Open Gaming  - MONDAYS - Dice rolling is back!
description:
**HOW IT WORKS:**

* **Step 1)** RSVP - let us know what you want to play, army/team, and experience level in the RSVP question answer field. RSVP's close 8 pm the night before the event so we can ensure all attendees are matched up.
* **Step 2)** Post below to find an opponent. Alternatively, we'd recommend using our WhatsApp chats to find a partner! If you're unable to do so, comment below and an Organiser will give you a hand.
* **Step 3)** Rock up at the venue, grab your pint, and throw down. Have fun!
* **Step 4)** pack away your stuff and revel in the glory of your victory
* **Step 5)** Join us on [facebook ](https://www.facebook.com/groups/579906745548869/)!

Follow us on Instagram and share your pics with us @lwarguild

***

**RSVP costs**: (You can change £ amount after clicking 'attend')
6x4 table: £7.50
4 x 4 table: £6
Bar Table: £5
Bar Table game without terrain (such as Blood Bowl or Underworlds): £4

The LWG is voluntarily run, and is a registered not for profit. All proceeds go towards the operating costs of the club (mostly venue hire!).

***

**AGENDA**:

6:30 p.m. - 7:00 p.m. SETUP

7:00 p.m. - GAMES START

10:45 p.m. - Wrap up

11:00 p.m. - Doors Close
---

ABOUT:

We can cater to pretty much any game you care to play including 40k, 9th Age, AOS, X-wing, Mordheim, Battle Fleet Gothic, Blood Bowl, Chess?

Beginners are more than welcome, we've got a mixed bag when it comes to levels of experience and we're all open to teaching the rules to any keen new kid on the block.

The location is near the popular Seven Dials area of Covent Garden. There's plenty of food up for grabs so feel free to grab something to bring. Beer and other bar refreshments available for very reasonable prices at the bar.

***

Matchups:

***

name: Sunday Masterclass Training with Chris Langridge @Euston
description:
Development Masterclass with Chris Langridge \| Olympic bronze medalist\, Rio 2016 \| Gold medalist at 2018 Commonwealth games \| 5x National Champion\.

We have teamed up with Chris and hope to do regular training sesssions to improve our members and the general badminton public.

This course is designed for players (intermediate and above) within a fun and engaging environment. We will focus on refining the basic skills and enhancing them.

The session will encompass every aspect of training so this can then be used and taken forward after the session to further your development.

Date: 15 May 2022

Time: 10 am to 12 Noon

Courts: Potentially 6 courts available, Max 18 Trainees

Session Fee: £26 per person.

Priority will be given to regular attendees of Central London Badminton Club as this session is part subsidised by the club. For non regulars the fee may be a little more. We hope to have future sessions for different level of players.

Please add yourself to the waitlist/ message me privately if interested in these sessions as will allow us to plan future sessions.

Venue: Somers Town Community Sports Centre
134 Chalton Street, London NW1 1RX
Free Street Parking Available.

Advanced payment required to secure a spot.
In the event you cannot attend (cancellation within 48 hours) a refund will be provided if a replacement trainee takes your place.

• You are responsible for your own well-being and we and the sports facility representatives will not be responsible for any injury, stolen or damaged property or any other occurrences during our sessions.

• Organisers: Mohammed (mr. nice guy), Vin (the merciless) and Moynul (the dark side of badminton)

Sunday Morning Badminton

Date: 24 April 2022

Time: 10 am to 12 Noon

Courts: 4 courts available

Shuttles: Feather (quality feathers)

Session Fee: £10 per person.
TWO HOURS OF BADMINTON - £10,

Venue: Somers Town Community Sports Centre
134 Chalton Street, London NW1 1RX
Free Street Parking Available.

This session is for those that are intermediate and above (strictly no beginners/ improvers/ Low Intermediates). We want to ensure the quality of play while controlling the standard of the club, this means that players who are not quite up to the standard may be asked politely to leave.

PLEASE PAY BEFORE THE BEGINNING OF THE SESSION EITHER VIA BANK TRANSFER/ PAYPAL.

IMPORTANT: OUR TERMS!
Coronavirus: Stay Safe, Play Safe
https://www.meetup.com/Central-London-Badminton-Club/boards/thread/52704882

PLEASE NOTE: DUE TO GUIDELINES, CURRENTLY THERE IS NO CHANGING ROOM FACILITIES AND NO SHOWER FACILITIES AVAILABLE AT THIS LOCATION.

Badminton Tactics:
https://www.meetup.com/Central-London-Badminton-Club/messages/boards/thread/52043613

\*PLEASE NOTE: LATE CANCELLATIONS (AFTER 6PM ON SATURDAY) OR NO-SHOWS WILL INCUR A PENALTY CHARGE OF £10. YOU WILL NEED TO PAY THE PENALTY CHARGE BEFORE BEING ALLOWED TO RSVP AT THE NEXT AVAILABLE SESSION.

• You are responsible for your own well-being and we and the sports facility representatives will not be responsible for any injury, stolen or damaged property or any other occurrences during our sessions.

• Organisers: Mohammed (mr. nice guy), Vin (the merciless) and Moynul (the dark side of badminton)

20s & 30s Ballie Ballerson Social | Epic Adult Playground
description:
**We don't do boring Wednesdays. And so this week, we will be kicking the midweek blues again and heading back to the famous Ballie Ballerson in Shoreditch for another evening of unadulterated ball pit madness for London 20s and 30s.**

The venue is one of the most popular yet unique bars in London and it has two huge ball pits that make it a truly epic adult playground and the perfect way to let loose during the week.

The bar offers a range of retro cocktails and pizza for you to enjoy between the ball pit battles.

Most importantly, over the course of the night - it’ll be a great opportunity to meet, connect with and have a bit of nostalgic fun with other Londoners in their 20s and 30.

\- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \-

**HOW IT WORKS**

The group will meet at 7:00pm in the main bar at Ballie Ballerson, where you can get a drink and play a few quick warm-up games before our time in the ball begins at 7:30pm.

We will then have 2 hours in the ball pit to unlock our inner child, swim through seas of plastic balls and probably eventually, start a full on ball pit war.

Following the adrenaline fuelled session - at 9:30pm, we will continue the night either to the main bar or explore the local Shoreditch bars for a drink or two, depending on the wishes of the group.

\- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \-

**HOW TO BOOK**

Attendance for the night is £5.50.

**To book your place, you will need to not just RSVP, but also purchase your ticket here: [https://shoreditch.ballieballerson.com/general-admission-baller-tickets/](https://shoreditch.ballieballerson.com/general-admission-baller-tickets/)

Please ensure you select the right date and time slot: **Wednesday 27th July - 7:30pm-9:30pm**

We understand these are very limited and will be offered on a first come, first serve basis. So if you are keen to join, please do get a ticket and RSVP as soon as you can!

Hopefully see you there!

\- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \- \-

**WHERE/WHEN**

This social night will take place at the following address:

Address: Ballie Ballerson,[masked] Curtain Rd, London EC2A 3BS (Location: [https://g.page/BallieBallersonShoreditch?share](https://g.page/BallieBallersonShoreditch?share))

Nearest Tube Stations: Old Street and Shoreditch High Street (approx 5 min walk)

Start Time: 7:00 PM

End Time: 10:30 PM

name: FREE Social Walk, Games & Pub - Crystal Palace to Brixton
description:
**It's back again. Another Sunday and we've got special social Walk and Pub trip for London 20s and 30s - for the first time, featuring dinosaurs.**

Yep this latest free social walk, we will be starting out at Crystal Palace in South London, home to a number of life-sized dinosaur statues that the park has become famous for.

After encountering these prehistoric creatures, we will then venture through the park, into Dulwich Woods, and through two of the most popular walking spots in South London, Dulwich Park and Brockwell Park.

We will then end up at a pub in Brixton where you'll be able to relax, have a drink and chat a bit more with those you've met on the walk. As with all our social walks, the event will feature:

* A Range of Fun, Games and Entertainment
* Speed Friending Activities
* Expert Games Host and Walk Guide
* Plenty of Like-Minded 20s to 30s
* The Great Outdoors and Stunning Scenery
* A Trip to the Pub (Optional but highly recommended!)

**HOW IT WORKS**

We will be meeting on the grass at the bottom of the Italian Terraces in Crystal Palace park at 2:00pm.

To start the event, you will be allocated a group/team for an initial mix of fun ice breaker games designed to get people talking and help you to get to know some of the other participants on the walk a little better.

After the games, we will commence our 2-3 hour walk to Brixton. Along the way, there will be a number of pit-stops (approx every 30-40 mins) where we will rotate the groups and play more social games.

After a few hours of nature, getting to know each other and working up a thirst, we'll head to a local pub and have a couple of drinks.

**WHERE/WHEN WE WILL MEET**

Meet Point - The Italian Terraces, Crystal Palace Park, London SE19 1LG (Location: [https://goo.gl/maps/FEMtBPQMJDvNCwKd8](https://goo.gl/maps/FEMtBPQMJDvNCwKd8))

Closest stations: Crystal Palace (5 min walk), Penge West (10 min walk), Penge East (15 min walk), Sydenham (15 min walk), and Gipsy Hill (15 min walk),

Destination: Effra Social, Brixton

Meet Time - 14:00 (we will leave at 14:10, so don't be late!)

Walk Finish time: 17:00 (approx)

Pub Finish time: 19:00-20:30 (Approx)

**WHAT TO BRING**

* Hiking shoes, boots or other suitable footwear
* Warm/Windproof layer (as it's London)
* Camera & phone
* Snacks
* Face mask, Hand Sanitizer etc.

**HEALTH AND SAFETY**

I'm sure you guys all know the drill by now, but just a reminder that everyone is responsible for their own safety on the walk and at the pub!

name: VIP Paintball Day | London 20 and 30s Social
description:
**We survived the [zombie apocalypse in June](https://www.meetup.com/20-30s-london-community-make-new-friends/events/286714557/), and so now with the extra shooting experience under our belts, we are excited to be upping the stakes and heading to our very first Paintball Social for London 20-30s.**

For this, we’ve booked out London's number one paintball venue, Mayhem Paintball Games just for you guys, so you can go up against your fellow 20s and 30s in a series of epic and fast-paced shootout games.

Over the course of the day, there will be up-to 12 different games, with a range of different missions and objectives designed to test your shooting and strategy.

The venue has 6 different arenas/game zones and offers some of the best military-style equipment in the UK, and you will also be given Call of Duty replica maps designed to help you complete the missions.

As a massive bonus, we’ve secured everyone a free gun upgrade AND a discount on the regular pricing. The premium equipment you will get to use is worth over £500 - simply incomparable to any other paintball rental experience.

After you’ve decorated your opponents with paint, we’ve secured a private area at a popular Indian restaurant for everyone to grab a bite to eat, exchange stories of their battles and get to know your fellow paintball opponents and team members a little better.

**WHAT YOU GET**

As part of this All-inclusive VIP paintball package included in the price is the following:

* Entry fee and unlimited air refills
* The latest dual pane thermal goggles with advanced ventilation to avoid fogging
* 500 paintballs (*additional paint and smoke grenades are available to purchase, but the 500 included paintballs will be more than enough for the average player*)
* Upgraded Planet Eclipse EMEK 100 paintball gun with extended barrel - more reliable, comfortable and effective
* Electronic quick feed no-jam loader
* Freshly laundered camouflage overalls and body armour

**WHEN/WHERE**

Meet at 9.30AM at Debden station on the Central Line - [https://goo.gl/maps/egfhQnhF66Jhhccw7](https://goo.gl/maps/egfhQnhF66Jhhccw7)

It is a 10 minute drive to Mayhem. We will try to arrange free car pools for those that arrive first, then order Ubers / share taxis (there is a taxi rank at the station).

Alternatively, you can meet us at 9:45AM at Mayhem, for a 10:00AM start.

Venue Address: Mayhem Paintball Games, Abridge, Romford RM4 1AA9 ([https://goo.gl/maps/8ggNdvuJRgf7DrHM8](https://goo.gl/maps/8ggNdvuJRgf7DrHM8))

Paintball - End Time: 3:30PM (approx., you can leave early as required)

For those that are feeling hungry, we will then head over to a nearby Balti-house where we have booked their private heated outdoor marquee for the rest of the day.

Theydon Bois Balti House: Station Approach, Theydon Bois, Epping CM16 7HR ([https://goo.gl/maps/eGXSgiVxehhiKbfu7](https://goo.gl/maps/eGXSgiVxehhiKbfu7))

Food/Drinks - End time: 8:00 PM (approx.)

**WHAT TO BRING**

* Snacks, lunch and drinks (as they have vending machines only).
* Trainers/hiking boots
* Comfortable clothing (tracksuit bottoms or shorts, sports t shirt)
* A change of clothes and shoes (for after the event)
* Lightweight gloves and knee pads can be are helpful but not necessary.

**REFUND POLICY**

As we need to secure the discounted price and private booking, no refunds are available. However, we expect there will be people on the waitlist whom you should be able to sell your ticket to if you provide enough notice.

You attend this event entirely at your own risk so please be sensible and follow all instructions given on the day – we accept no liability and cannot be held accountable for any loss or injury.

**MORE INFORMATION**

Mayhem’s complete FAQs are available here: [https://www.mayhempaintball.co.uk/about/faq](https://www.mayhempaintball.co.uk/about/faq)

Mayhem’s outline of what will happen on the day is here: [https://www.mayhempaintball.co.uk/about/what-is-involved](https://www.mayhempaintball.co.uk/about/what-is-involved)

name: War Meet - Open Gaming  - MONDAYS - Dice rolling is back!
description:
**HOW IT WORKS:**

* **Step 1)** RSVP - let us know what you want to play, army/team, and experience level in the RSVP question answer field. RSVP's close 8 pm the night before the event so we can ensure all attendees are matched up.
* **Step 2)** Post below to find an opponent. Alternatively, we'd recommend using our WhatsApp chats to find a partner! If you're unable to do so, comment below and an Organiser will give you a hand.
* **Step 3)** Rock up at the venue, grab your pint, and throw down. Have fun!
* **Step 4)** pack away your stuff and revel in the glory of your victory
* **Step 5)** Join us on [facebook ](https://www.facebook.com/groups/579906745548869/)!

Follow us on Instagram and share your pics with us @lwarguild

***

**RSVP costs**: (You can change £ amount after clicking 'attend')
6x4 table: £7.50
4 x 4 table: £6
Bar Table: £5
Bar Table game without terrain (such as Blood Bowl or Underworlds): £4

The LWG is voluntarily run, and is a registered not for profit. All proceeds go towards the operating costs of the club (mostly venue hire!).

***

**AGENDA**:

6:30 p.m. - 7:00 p.m. SETUP

7:00 p.m. - GAMES START

10:45 p.m. - Wrap up

11:00 p.m. - Doors Close
---

ABOUT:

We can cater to pretty much any game you care to play including 40k, 9th Age, AOS, X-wing, Mordheim, Battle Fleet Gothic, Blood Bowl, Chess?

Beginners are more than welcome, we've got a mixed bag when it comes to levels of experience and we're all open to teaching the rules to any keen new kid on the block.

The location is near the popular Seven Dials area of Covent Garden. There's plenty of food up for grabs so feel free to grab something to bring. Beer and other bar refreshments available for very reasonable prices at the bar.

***

Matchups:

***

name: Dungeons & Dragons - Londinium Casual 'drop in' Campaign Session
description:
Welcome to the LWG Casual D&D Campaign! Going forward, we will schedule in-person sessions at Seven Dials on Mondays, and continue our Online sessions on Tuesdays, where DM & player interest is there!

From first timers to veterans, drop in to any sessions you want. We'll sort you into groups in the text below approx 24 hours before the session starts, and get you started on a one-shot adventure that fits into our campaign setting.

What is it?
Casual drop-in games set in the same world with an over-arching story. Play as much and whenever you like! Never played? No problem! Arrive early and we'll help you build a character, or we have a few set ones you can borrow.

What Do I Bring?
Pencil & paper, character sheet, dice, Player's Handbook & any other source books your character uses.

NEW PLAYERS:
You can make a level 2 character (PHB+1) and jump right in. Let your DM know you're new. If you need help with creating a character, reach out to any DM or Admin in our Whatsapp chat or Discord ( https://discord.gg/Dg2BeDR ), we're happy to help you along!

MORE INFO:
https://drive.google.com/open?id=1s22yxbraAcz53UcUE1iM8WhMeTIcRQWB

Arrival: 6:30 - 7pm.
Adventure!: 7-10pm
After session social: 10-11pm.
Please do be a few minutes early, as we MUST start at 7pm sharp!

NB: The London Wargaming Guild is a non-profit, and is entirely volunteer-run. All fees charged go towards the running costs of the Guild (mostly venue rents) - every penny!

Thus, organisers and DMs do not get paid for their time. We do it because we enjoy it, and because we love the community in the Guild - and we hope you will too!

**Matchups/Tables**:

**DISCLAIMER**: By attending the club you agree to have read and abide by our aforementioned Coronavirus Guidelines, if they are updated. You, as the attendees, are responsible for maintaining adherence to these guidelines. While the club is taking precautions to reduce the risk of transmission it cannot be ruled out. By attending you acknowledge that you are accepting this risk.

name: War Meet - Open Gaming  - Wednesdays @ Bad Moon
description:
**HOW IT WORKS:**

* **Step 1) RSVP** \- let us know what to play\, army/team\, and experience level / opponent if you have one arranged\.
* **Step 2) POST BELOW** to find an opponent - alternatively, The Organisers will help match you up. (check below for your pairing!)
* **Step 3)** **TURN UP -** Tables will be allocated at the venue, so turn up, grab some refreshments, and throw down. Have fun!
* **Step 4)** Join us on [facebook ](https://www.facebook.com/groups/579906745548869/)! Follow us on [instagram](www.instagram.com/lwarguild)!

[Find out more about LWG + BMC ](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=clsDBUUDFUY)

***

6x4 Games - £7.50

***

**AGENDA**:

* **18:00** \- START
* **21:45 p.m. -** Wrap up
* **22:00 p.m.** \- Doors Close

***

**The Location:** The event is held at the Bad Moon Cafe. The venue offers barista coffee, craft beer, wood-fired pizza, and a large stock of Games Workshop and board game products for purchase.

Beginners are more than welcome, we've got a mixed bag when it comes to levels of experience and we're all open to teaching the rules to any keen new kid on the block.

* **Step 3)** Rock up at the venue, grab your pint, and throw down. Have fun!
* **Step 4)** pack away your stuff and revel in the glory of your victory
* **Step 5)** Join us on [facebook ](https://www.facebook.com/groups/579906745548869/)!

Follow us on Instagram and share your pics with us @lwarguild

***

**RSVP costs**: (You can change £ amount after clicking 'attend')
6x4 table: £7.50
4 x 4 table: £6
Bar Table: £5
Bar Table game without terrain (such as Blood Bowl or Underworlds): £4

The LWG is voluntarily run, and is a registered not for profit. All proceeds go towards the operating costs of the club (mostly venue hire!).

***

**AGENDA**:

6:30 p.m. - 7:00 p.m. SETUP

7:00 p.m. - GAMES START

10:45 p.m. - Wrap up

11:00 p.m. - Doors Close
---

ABOUT:

We can cater to pretty much any game you care to play including 40k, 9th Age, AOS, X-wing, Mordheim, Battle Fleet Gothic, Blood Bowl, Chess?

Beginners are more than welcome, we've got a mixed bag when it comes to levels of experience and we're all open to teaching the rules to any keen new kid on the block.

The location is near the popular Seven Dials area of Covent Garden. There's plenty of food up for grabs so feel free to grab something to bring. Beer and other bar refreshments available for very reasonable prices at the bar.

***

Matchups:

* **Step 1) RSVP -** let us know what you want to play, army/team, and experience level in the RSVP question answer field. RSVP's close 8 pm the night before the event so we can ensure all attendees are matched up.
* **Step 2)** Post below to find an opponent. Alternatively, we'd recommend using our WhatsApp chats to find a partner! If you're unable to do so, comment below and an Organiser will give you a hand.
* **Step 3)** Rock up at the venue, grab your pint, and throw down. Have fun!
* **Step 4)** pack away your stuff and revel in the glory of your victory
* **Step 5)** Join us on[ facebook ](https://www.facebook.com/groups/579906745548869/)! and follow us on Instagram and share your pics with us @lwarguild

***

**RSVP costs:** (You can change £ amount after clicking 'attend')

* 6x4 table: £7.50
* 4 x 4 table: £6
* Bar Table: £5
* Bar Table game without terrain (such as Blood Bowl or Underworlds): £4

The LWG is voluntarily run, and is a registered not-for-profit. All proceeds go towards the operating costs of the club (mostly venue hire!).

***

**AGENDA:**

6:30 p.m. - 7:00 p.m. SETUP

7:00 p.m. - GAMES START

10:45 p.m. - Wrap up

11:00 p.m. - Doors Close
---

**ABOUT**:

We can cater to pretty much any game you care to play including 40k, 9th Age, AOS, X-wing, Mordheim, Battle Fleet Gothic, Blood Bowl, Chess?

Beginners are more than welcome, we've got a mixed bag when it comes to levels of experience and we're all open to teaching the rules to any keen new kid on the block.

The location is near the popular Seven Dials area of Covent Garden. There's plenty of food up for grabs so feel free to grab something to bring. Beer and other bar refreshments available for very reasonable prices at the bar.

***

**Matchups/Tables**:

**DISCLAIMER**: By attending the club you agree to have read and abide by our aforementioned Coronavirus Guidelines, if they are updated. You, as the attendees, are responsible for maintaining adherence to these guidelines. While the club is taking precautions to reduce the risk of transmission it cannot be ruled out. By attending you acknowledge that you are accepting this risk.

***

Can cater to pretty much any game you care to play including 40k, 9th Age, AOS, X-wing, Mordheim, Battle Fleet Gothic, Blood Bowl, Chess?

Beginners are more than welcome, we've got a mixed bag when it comes to levels of experience and we're all open to teaching the rules to any keen new kid on the block.

name: Thursday Evening Badminton - Intermediate and above @Euston
description:
Thursday Evening Badminton

Date: 28 July 2022

Time: 7:30 pm to 10:00 pm

Courts: 3 courts available

Shuttles: Feather (quality feathers)

Session Fee: £10 per person.
TWO & HALF HOURS OF BADMINTON - £10,

Venue: Somers Town Community Sports Centre
134 Chalton Street, London NW1 1RX
Free Street Parking Available.

This session is for those that are intermediate and above (strictly no beginners/ improvers/ Low Intermediates). We want to ensure the quality of play while controlling the standard of the club, this means that players who are not quite up to the standard may be asked politely to leave.

PLEASE PAY BEFORE THE BEGINNING OF THE SESSION EITHER VIA BANK TRANSFER/ PAYPAL.

IMPORTANT: OUR TERMS!
Coronavirus: Stay Safe, Play Safe
https://www.meetup.com/Central-London-Badminton-Club/boards/thread/52704882

PLEASE NOTE: DUE TO GUIDELINES, CURRENTLY THERE IS NO CHANGING ROOM FACILITIES AND NO SHOWER FACILITIES AVAILABLE AT THIS LOCATION.

Badminton Tactics:
https://www.meetup.com/Central-London-Badminton-Club/messages/boards/thread/52043613

\*PLEASE NOTE: LATE CANCELLATIONS (AFTER 10PM ON WEDNESDAY) OR NO-SHOWS WILL INCUR A PENALTY CHARGE OF £10. YOU WILL NEED TO PAY THE PENALTY CHARGE BEFORE BEING ALLOWED TO RSVP AT THE NEXT AVAILABLE SESSION.

• You are responsible for your own well-being and we and the sports facility representatives will not be responsible for any injury, stolen or damaged property or any other occurrences during our sessions.

• Organisers: Mohammed (mr. nice guy), Vin (the merciless) and Moynul (the dark side of badminton)
